text.text_translated:
Wasfia gave her life to help human rights. She saw many projects in her country. These projects came from other countries. They helped women and girls. They taught and trained them. But these projects stopped. This happened too often. Then the women and girls had nothing.

Wasfia saw this problem. She felt Bangladesh needed to help itself. She had two strong interests. One was climbing mountains. The other was human rights. She put these two interests together. She wanted to change how people think about women in her country.

She started climbing mountains. She was doing work to help people in Tibet and Nepal then. Bangladesh is a flat country near the sea. Most people there never saw a mountain.

Her big plan is working. People in her country are now paying attention. They are really noticing it. People in other countries are also paying attention.

best_attempt.text_translated:
`Human rights` are rules. They say all people should be treated well. Everyone has these rights.

Wasfia spent her life `supporting human rights`. She saw many `humanitarian projects` from other countries. These projects taught and trained women and girls in her country. But these projects stopped. This happened too many times. Then the women and girls had nothing.

Wasfia saw this problem. She `thought` Bangladesh needed to stand up for itself. She had two strong loves. One was `climbing` mountains. The other was `human rights`. She `joined` these two loves together. She wanted to change how people feel about women in her country.

She started `climbing` mountains. She was doing `humanitarian work` in Tibet and Nepal then. Bangladesh is a flat country near the sea. Most people there never saw a mountain.

Her plan seems to be `doing the trick`. People in her country are starting to notice. People in other countries are also noticing.
